title: 103_hr4165
content: The Act titled "Public Housing Development Reform Amendments" allows for the elimination of the review process by contract. The United States Housing Act of 1937 is amended to allow the elimination of interim review in the development process for high-performing public housing agencies. The Secretary may exempt projects from review if they comply with management standards in an exemplary manner. Under the contract, the Secretary or any office of the Department of Housing and Urban Development reviews compliance with qualified development requirements. Remedies in the contract ensure that the public housing project complies with these requirements upon completion of development or acquisition. The contract allows for civil monetary penalties up to $10,000 if the public housing project fails to comply with development requirements regarding site, neighborhood standards, or environmental regulations. Penalties are imposed after a hearing if the Secretary determines non-compliance. The contract for contributions may not exceed $1,000,000 and includes specific performance requirements to correct noncompliance. The Secretary can withhold payments until the project meets development requirements and withhold assistance for project operation. The contract for contributions may not exceed $1,000,000 and includes specific performance requirements to correct noncompliance. The Secretary can withhold payments until the project meets development requirements, which include site and neighborhood standards, design and construction standards, cost guidelines, environmental requirements, zoning compliance, and selection of utilities. The Secretary may provide additional requirements or standards. This subsection does not waive any qualified development requirements for public housing projects after the contract period expires. The United States Housing Act of 1937 is amended to allow for waivers or alterations of construction commencement requirements for public housing projects that include authorized provisions.
